page.title: 10FARMING - TYSOE - GENERAL
page.content: In the 1980s farmers are facing problems of surpluses. Even in this rural community it is having its effect. Milk Quotas imposed by the EEC are causing problems particularly for smaller farms. Land for sale tends to be bought by neighbouring farms. The house and buildings of one farm sold in 1985 is being kept to develop the Bed and Breakfast trade which has increased greatly this decade. Very little labour is employed on the fifteen farms in the area, they mainly depend on family labour. About half the area is covered by the few larger units which are mainly arable, but these are on the periphery of the village. The farms closer to the village tend to be mainly grass, stocking beef and sheep, five of them having a dairy herd as well.
